Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries/Prelude/Relation/carrier
Synopsis Return the set of all elements in any tuple in a relation.
Function
  1. set[&T] carrier (rel[&T,&T] R)
  2. set[&T] carrier (rel[&T,&T,&T] R)
  3. set[&T] carrier (rel[&T,&T,&T,&T] R)
  4. set[&T] carrier (rel[&T,&T,&T,&T,&T] R)
Usage import Relation;
Examples 
rascal>import Relation;
ok
rascal>carrier({<1,10>, <2,20>});
set[int]: {10,20,2,1}
rascal>carrier({<1,10,100,1000>, <2,20,200,2000>});
set[int]: {10,1000,200,100,20,2,1,2000}

Questions
Question [1].
The type of carrier({<-11, -12>, <-12, -7>, <4, 11>, <-9, 12>, <3, -20>}) is

Question [2].
The type of carrier({<"E", -15>, <"Ginger", -16>}) is

Question [3]. 
carrier({<"Ernie", -17>, <"A", -14>, <"Ginger", 17>, <"Basil", -2>}) ==
